oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Site of the Napier Homes, c.1939
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of the project site for the J.C. Napier Homes (Project Tenn. 5-2 and 5-2A), circa 1939. After the Nashville Housing Authority was first approved by the City Council in 1938, they began work on an application to build two low-cost housing projects, namely Boscobel Heights (later named after James A. Cayce) and the J.C. Napier Homes (named for James Carroll Napier). Photographed by the Nashville Housing Authority. Forms part of the MDHA Photograph Collection. 1 photograph : b & w.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Nashville Housing Authority (Nashville, Tenn.);
